A widow has sued General Mo-
tors Corporation, alleging her
husband died as a result of a
faulty mechanism in a vehicle
he was driving. She seeks $500,
900 damages.


Mrs. Inez Rosser, 1853 E. Al
meria, said her husband, Arthur
Rosser, died Sept. 10 from In
juries receive when the auto
mobile he was driving Aug. IA,
1868. went out of control and
struck a utility pole alongside
US. Highway 80 south of Chand-
Ter.


Rosser was an X-ray super
visor for the u. S. Public Health
Service, said Harold Goldman,
plaintiff S counsel. The vehicle,
a 1861 Chevrolet, belonged to
the government motor poool here.

CHICAGO Mrs. Rose Kennedy
68, who was arrested after the
death of her common in law
husband, policymaker. Lawrence
Wakefield, was freed last week.


Judge Ben Schwartz ruled to
suppress evidence secured by
policemen because they lacked
a warrant.


Government agents have filed
a claim for $15O,OO0 of the
S763 900 cash found in the apart
ment of Wakefield. Also found
were seven guns and ii policy
printing presses.


Mrs. Kennedy will attempt to
recover the money and other
articles by filing in probate court.
